entry.title: Combined summary - Pizza for (lightning) bitcoins?
entry.summary: Laszlo Hanyecz, a Lightning Network user, successfully purchased two pizzas using Bitcoin's second layer scaling solution. This demonstrates the potential benefits of this technology for everyday transactions. However, further development and adoption of the Lightning Network and other scaling solutions are needed for Bitcoin to become a more practical form of currency.To buy the pizzas, Laszlo decided to use the Lightning Network and his friend in London acted as a middleman to sub-contract a local pizza shop for delivery. They improvised to avoid prepaying and ending up without pizza by agreeing that Laszlo would need to provide the payment hash preimage to the delivery driver in order to claim his pizza. The preimage was agreed upon beforehand to be the first and last four characters of the hex string.The process involved opening a channel and funding it with a sufficient amount. Laszlo's friend verified that he funded a channel on the blockchain. When the pizza delivery arrived, Laszlo paid the invoice and received the preimage instantly in return. The customer provides the preimage to the pizza provider via the LN protocol, confirming the transaction and releasing the pizza to the customer.ZmnSCPxj, a contributor to the Lightning Network, shared guidance on how to use Bitcoin via the Lightning Network to pay for pizza. This involves creating a direct channel with the pizza provider and transferring the pizza price plus 546 satoshi to them. The pizza provider must then deliver the pizza within three blocks or it's free.Overall, Laszlo's use of the Lightning Network to buy pizza showcases the potential benefits of this technology for everyday transactions.
